revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2021-10-04 17:03:40.000000000', 'files': ['mariadb/Chart.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/mariadb.yaml', 'mariadb/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Disables optimistic pa in Maridb Config
Per:
https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-22766

1) if cert.optimistic_pa=NO Mariadb pods can be
restarted without any issue.
2) Mariadb can be upgraded from 10.2.x to 10.4.x and
conditionally set cert.optimistic_pa=NO for 10.4.x
only. cert.optimistic_pa=false is not support for
10.2.x and 10.2.x will not start if the option is set
3) This patchset was tested by upgrading Mariadb
from version 10.2.32 to 10.4.17

Change-Id: I2f5ba7a443557019d5c594cbedea4ea5907195db
'}]
commit_message:
Disables optimistic pa in Maridb Config
Per:
https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-22766

1) if cert.optimistic_pa=NO Mariadb pods can be
restarted without any issue.
2) Mariadb can be upgraded from 10.2.x to 10.4.x and
conditionally set cert.optimistic_pa=NO for 10.4.x
only. cert.optimistic_pa=false is not support for
10.2.x and 10.2.x will not start if the option is set
3) This patchset was tested by upgrading Mariadb
from version 10.2.32 to 10.4.17

Change-Id: I2f5ba7a443557019d5c594cbedea4ea5907195db

subject: fix(neutron): exclude 127.0.0.1 from tunnel ip detection
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-08-15 14:11:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/templates/bin/_neutron-linuxbridge-agent-init.sh.tpl', 'neutron/Chart.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron.yaml'], 'message': "fix(neutron): exclude 127.0.0.1 from tunnel ip detection

The tunnel ip detection script includes 127.0.0.1 as a valid option
when selecting the tunnel IP addresses. This causes issues when using
anycast addresses on the loopback interface.

This change excludes 127.0.0.1 from the selection so only other
addresses remain. This should not cause issues for existing users
as it's not possible to setup VXLAN tunnels to other nodes when
using 127.0.0.1 as tunnel endpoint.

Change-Id: I9800120f58376c755e666a77f0bf5476d9d9337e
"}]
commit_message:
fix(neutron): exclude 127.0.0.1 from tunnel ip detection

The tunnel ip detection script includes 127.0.0.1 as a valid option
when selecting the tunnel IP addresses. This causes issues when using
anycast addresses on the loopback interface.

This change excludes 127.0.0.1 from the selection so only other
addresses remain. This should not cause issues for existing users
as it's not possible to setup VXLAN tunnels to other nodes when
using 127.0.0.1 as tunnel endpoint.

Change-Id: I9800120f58376c755e666a77f0bf5476d9d9337e

use manual cert injection.

Change-Id: I89f3bb88f4387b315e57552712eae1922a4afd84
'}]
commit_message:
Enable issuer usage for public ingresses

Now internal ingress only uses cert issuer and public ingresses only
use manual cert injection.
But there is a case using letsencrypt issuer so we can publish valid
cert for public ingresses also.

Change-Id: I89f3bb88f4387b315e57552712eae1922a4afd84

subject: Allow for dynamic ks-user-job name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8863, 'name': 'Andrii Ostapenko', 'email': 'anost1986@gmail.com', 'username': 'aostapenko'}, {'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 28235, 'name': 'Aaron Sheffield', 'email': 'ajs@sheffieldfamily.net', 'username': 'aaronsheffield'}, {'_account_id': 30745, 'name': 'Kelly Carter', 'email': 'KC755D@att.com', 'username': 'kc755d'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2021-08-20 15:20:44.000000000', 'files': ['helm-toolkit/templates/manifests/_job-ks-user.yaml.tpl'], 'message': 'Allow for dynamic ks-user-job name

In the scenario of a helm chart which will be used by multiple armada
charts, this means that we will have overlapping Kubernetes resources
in the same namespace.
To avoid issues and keep the resources attached to their specific armada
chart (release), we need the names of each resource to be:
    {{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }}.
Now, in using the ks-user job, the name is set to:
    name: {{ printf "%s-%s" $serviceUserPretty "ks-user" | quote }}
^ $serviceUserPretty is just $serviceUser replacing “_”:
    {{- $serviceUserPretty := $serviceUser | replace "_" "-" -}}

So if we want the name to be unique ({{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }})
we have to send this in as $serviceUser …
The issue comes up when ks-user-job grabs values from values.yaml:
envAll.Values.secrets.identity $serviceUser
envAll.Values.endpoints.identity.auth $serviceUser

Now our values.yaml HAS to be overridden in every armada chart to solve
this AND it will fail helm lint, because who knows when you do a helm
lint what you need to put in the values.yaml when it generates a unique
release name.

We want more flexibility in the ks-user-job, to allow for the name to be
unique (based of release) while not having to override values in
values.yaml and also pass helm linting (side effect of needing specific
values in values.yaml).

Change-Id: I6758cefbb17e369d3a39f812d63bd487a08f47f0
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for dynamic ks-user-job name

In the scenario of a helm chart which will be used by multiple armada
charts, this means that we will have overlapping Kubernetes resources
in the same namespace.
To avoid issues and keep the resources attached to their specific armada
chart (release), we need the names of each resource to be:
    {{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }}.
Now, in using the ks-user job, the name is set to:
    name: {{ printf "%s-%s" $serviceUserPretty "ks-user" | quote }}
^ $serviceUserPretty is just $serviceUser replacing “_”:
    {{- $serviceUserPretty := $serviceUser | replace "_" "-" -}}

So if we want the name to be unique ({{ Release.Name }}-{{ Name }})
we have to send this in as $serviceUser …
The issue comes up when ks-user-job grabs values from values.yaml:
envAll.Values.secrets.identity $serviceUser
envAll.Values.endpoints.identity.auth $serviceUser

Now our values.yaml HAS to be overridden in every armada chart to solve
this AND it will fail helm lint, because who knows when you do a helm
lint what you need to put in the values.yaml when it generates a unique
release name.

We want more flexibility in the ks-user-job, to allow for the name to be
unique (based of release) while not having to override values in
values.yaml and also pass helm linting (side effect of needing specific
values in values.yaml).

Change-Id: I6758cefbb17e369d3a39f812d63bd487a08f47f0

subject: Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-08-19 07:49:47.000000000', 'files': ['libvirt/Chart.yaml', 'libvirt/templates/daemonset-libvirt.yaml', 'libvirt/values_overrides/ssl.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/libvirt.yaml'], 'message': "Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'

1. Put clientkey.pem in the /etc/pki/libvirt/private directory.
2. The value of the configuration item 'listen_tcp' should be '1',
otherwise nova-compute could not  connect to libvirt.
3. '_ tls_volume.tpl' does not support parameters 'path', 'certs'.

Change-Id: I775e1c57ca31bfb2067d4a3e8110a0b73f955908
"}]
commit_message:
Fix problems in commit 'Realize libvirt SSL'

1. Put clientkey.pem in the /etc/pki/libvirt/private directory.
2. The value of the configuration item 'listen_tcp' should be '1',
otherwise nova-compute could not  connect to libvirt.
3. '_ tls_volume.tpl' does not support parameters 'path', 'certs'.

Change-Id: I775e1c57ca31bfb2067d4a3e8110a0b73f955908

subject: Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2021-06-07 14:31:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/templates/configmap-etc.yaml', 'cinder/templates/job-create-internal-tenant.yaml', 'cinder/templates/deployment-volume.yaml', 'cinder/templates/job-db-sync.yaml', 'cinder/templates/secret-db.yaml', 'cinder/templates/deployment-backup.yaml', 'cinder/templates/cron-job-cinder-volume-usage-audit.yaml', 'cinder/templates/deployment-api.yaml', 'cinder/templates/deployment-scheduler.yaml', 'cinder/Chart.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/cinder.yaml', 'cinder/templates/job-db-init.yaml', 'cinder/templates/job-db-drop.yaml'], 'message': 'Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Cinder

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: I2900701d45c141867929370957c7acde47969acc
'}]
commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Cinder

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: I2900701d45c141867929370957c7acde47969acc

commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Horizon

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Iec6045b8c4cd45c22d49be27da2dc6189dd5358e

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2021-05-28 08:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/templates/job-db-sync.yaml', 'nova/templates/job-db-init.yaml', 'nova/templates/configmap-etc.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-conductor.yaml', 'nova/templates/pod-rally-test.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-api-osapi.yaml', 'nova/templates/cron-job-cell-setup.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-placement.yaml', 'nova/templates/job-cell-setup.yaml', 'nova/Chart.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-novncproxy.yaml', 'nova/templates/secret-db-cell0.yaml', 'nova/templates/secret-db.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-consoleauth.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/nova.yaml', 'nova/templates/cron-job-service-cleaner.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-api-metadata.yaml', 'nova/templates/secret-db-api.yaml', 'nova/templates/deployment-scheduler.yaml', 'nova/templates/job-db-drop.yaml'], 'message': 'Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Nova

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Iae43edf23e9e044d38e98838602d43416efdd112
'}]
commit_message:
Added PostgreSQL TLS support and snippets fixing cert permissions for Nova

Due to psycopg2 enforcing file permissions and ownership on TLS
certificates during connections to PostgreSQL, this approach uses init
containers, because:
- 0600-or-less permissions are expected of TLS private keys, just
  mouting the subpath or specifying per-item permissions achieves this,
  however…
- certificates need to be owned by the in-container system user
  connecting to the database, which rarely ends up being the case

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/771773/
Change-Id: Iae43edf23e9e044d38e98838602d43416efdd112

commit_message:
Remove create_floating_ip & get_server_ip methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Barbican tempest plugin still uses nova-network old interface for floating ip related methods, this patch removes them and use tempests's ones which already use neutron's interface.[2]

Replaced methods:
	* create_floating_ip
	* get_server_ip

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6428139de18291c916852ae48130fb8a7b4db318

Change-Id: I2f6b61d868f9fc68cf000627a5a905083af6ace7

commit_message:
Iptables rule for geneve traffic should match UNTRACKED state

In the raw table we are explicity set Geneve traffic to be not tracked
by conntrack. Because of that we should later in the filter table match
on the UNTRACKED geneve traffic instead of NEW.

Closes-Bug: #1972283
Change-Id: If744e35d4c0286a50ccf0220c122f8355d5833f2

commit_message:
Make bootstrap tasks more modular

To avoid calling the same tasks multiple times,
this change splits out the packages component.
This allows us to call it from other tasks without
running the entire role

Change-Id: Ifc38772898e864af9c76d45e87b34e4390bfd033

subject: Do not auto subquery load DistributedPortBindings
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-05-16 07:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/models.py'], 'message': 'Do not auto subquery load DistributedPortBindings

We observe excessive DB calls to load DistributedPortBindings,
We have enabled DVR and have some huge virtual routers with around
60 router interfaces scheduled on around 200 compute nodes. Under such
situation, subquery load DistributedPortBinding looks like not a very wise
idea, because it is not explicitly used.

I glance through the code and have a feeling that ml2_distributed_port_bindings
is not used except explicitly called. So IMO it is safe to change it to
default lazy load without causing serious regression.

Closes-bug: #1973576
Change-Id: Ib2c48bd5ad55e9c754a8e4938e6c5eafacc75dcc
'}]
commit_message:
Do not auto subquery load DistributedPortBindings

We observe excessive DB calls to load DistributedPortBindings,
We have enabled DVR and have some huge virtual routers with around
60 router interfaces scheduled on around 200 compute nodes. Under such
situation, subquery load DistributedPortBinding looks like not a very wise
idea, because it is not explicitly used.

I glance through the code and have a feeling that ml2_distributed_port_bindings
is not used except explicitly called. So IMO it is safe to change it to
default lazy load without causing serious regression.

Closes-bug: #1973576
Change-Id: Ib2c48bd5ad55e9c754a8e4938e6c5eafacc75dcc

commit_message:
Allow to filter multiple tags for image list

Currently in case of passing `--tag` several times, only last one will
be picked up for the filtering. In the meanwhile Glance allow option to
be repeated multiple times to filter based on the multiple tags.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/789827
Change-Id: I7379d0b0014f0e3d13b02ee5ec6b642a7a5aa7d1

subject: Set volume/build_timeout for zuul jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-14 16:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Set volume/build_timeout for zuul jobs

The default in tempest is 196, and we're seeing backup test failures
where the backup completes shortly after that.  So increase it to
300 in the  cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-barbican-base-abstract job,
which should propagate it out to most of the other jobs.

Change-Id: I87c0669e91ba49a66a48b0722fcf140091f6b19f
"}]
commit_message:
Set volume/build_timeout for zuul jobs

The default in tempest is 196, and we're seeing backup test failures
where the backup completes shortly after that.  So increase it to
300 in the  cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-barbican-base-abstract job,
which should propagate it out to most of the other jobs.

Change-Id: I87c0669e91ba49a66a48b0722fcf140091f6b19f

commit_message:
Make U content-provider & V upgrades voting again

In patch[1], we marked Ussuri content-provider and Victoria
upgrade jobs non-voting because Ussuri content-provider was
down because of quay.ceph.io outage.

Removing voting:false as Ussuri content-provider is back
after quay.ceph.io restoration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/841549

Related-Bug: #1973115
Change-Id: I9bde591cd2cd3f8133189ec238106a6e31af4d27

subject: Increase swap size to 4GB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-14 16:31:08.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Increase swap size to 4GB

The ceph jobs are failing apparently due to mysqld being reaped by
the oom reaper, which of course cascades into service failures due
to db errors.  Increasing the swap size allows the jobs to run to
completion.

Default is 1G.  See other patches on topic: increase-swap to see
how 4G was determined.

Change-Id: Ibf2a7fd2a305d04303b1288a6f1faebfc9ffd6de
'}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size to 4GB

The ceph jobs are failing apparently due to mysqld being reaped by
the oom reaper, which of course cascades into service failures due
to db errors.  Increasing the swap size allows the jobs to run to
completion.

Default is 1G.  See other patches on topic: increase-swap to see
how 4G was determined.

Change-Id: Ibf2a7fd2a305d04303b1288a6f1faebfc9ffd6de

commit_message:
Added tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard parent

Reparenting tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone jobs,
Now scenario jobs directly parent with
tripleo-ci-base-standalone-standard job, it will
completely remove multiparenting from scenario jobs.

CS parenting structure:
* tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard
** tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario0XX-standalone
** tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario0XX-standalone

Moved all files (Trigger files), vars, featureset under job:
- tripleo-ci-scenario0XX-standalone-standard

Branches, Release, nodeset handeled by:
- tripleo-ci-centos-{8,9}-scenario0XX-standalone

Change-Id: Ib57afbac86afa29a4897682b094c8f593b5ccf45
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

This patch also fixes a broken test by updating the maximum
payload size to match the current maximum in Barbican. [3]

This patch also skips an additional broken test.  It will be
fixed in a separate patch.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/src/branch/stable/yoga/barbican/common/config.py#L33

Change-Id: Id192b8eef2c2518b8a89f200727bd03c47dbd07e

subject: Increase swap size to 4GB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-13 16:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Increase swap size to 4GB

This is to address issues in the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest* jobs
where a significant number of builds are failing.  Symptoms are a
lot of server fault errors, identity error: unexpected status
code 500, and db connection errors in the tempest log.  On these
jobs, syslog shows multiple
   oom_reaper: reaped process xxxxxxx (mysqld)
lines.  Occasionally ceph-osd or ceph-mons are also reaped, but
it's pretty consistently mysqld.

Default swap size is currently 1G.  Increase to 4GB was determined
experimentally.  (See other patches on topic: increase-swap.)

Change-Id: I3c08f363f5b74e1fe7900f4398bd2cb6df3a80d7
"}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size to 4GB

This is to address issues in the cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest* jobs
where a significant number of builds are failing.  Symptoms are a
lot of server fault errors, identity error: unexpected status
code 500, and db connection errors in the tempest log.  On these
jobs, syslog shows multiple
   oom_reaper: reaped process xxxxxxx (mysqld)
lines.  Occasionally ceph-osd or ceph-mons are also reaped, but
it's pretty consistently mysqld.

Default swap size is currently 1G.  Increase to 4GB was determined
experimentally.  (See other patches on topic: increase-swap.)

Change-Id: I3c08f363f5b74e1fe7900f4398bd2cb6df3a80d7

subject: Add the dbus-tools package to manila-share image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25402, 'name': 'Francesco Pantano', 'email': 'fpantano@redhat.com', 'username': 'fmount'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 20:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/tcib/base/os/manila-base/manila-share/manila-share.yaml'], 'message': 'Add the dbus-tools package to manila-share image

If configuring manila-share with the Ceph-via-NFS
driver, the service communicates with the NFS-Ganesha
gateway via DBUS [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html#deployment-considerations

commit_message:
Add the dbus-tools package to manila-share image

If configuring manila-share with the Ceph-via-NFS
driver, the service communicates with the NFS-Ganesha
gateway via DBUS [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html#deployment-considerations

Change-Id: I310a3c766ec81caa04748ea6f62523e8c9678d55
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-22 16:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Limit pyroute2 to be <=0.6.5

[1] limited pyroute to be lower or equal than 0.6.6 to avoid new
exception NetlinkDumpInterrupted, but it badly read which pyroute
releases contain this new feature with the above exception.
So go down one more verison of pyroute to 0.6.5 and below.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/833025
Related-Bug: #1962608

Change-Id: I35e6215ccb407da6a8d23f8e7bd2f8a0e779fe2c
'}]
commit_message:
Limit pyroute2 to be <=0.6.5

[1] limited pyroute to be lower or equal than 0.6.6 to avoid new
exception NetlinkDumpInterrupted, but it badly read which pyroute
releases contain this new feature with the above exception.
So go down one more verison of pyroute to 0.6.5 and below.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/833025
Related-Bug: #1962608

Change-Id: I35e6215ccb407da6a8d23f8e7bd2f8a0e779fe2c

commit_message:
Update devstack-heat

This useful tool was outdated and written really clumsily. This commit
rewrites bash code to Python, adds options like peeking stack.sh logs,
deploying from a commit or branch and fixes deploying from a gerrit
change.

Change-Id: Icaa01d660b2cdf376d6f000230114986a454c4fb

commit_message:
[Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules

In rare scenarios, an access rule known to manila may
be missing from CephFS. The driver shouldn't raise an
exception when this happens.

Change-Id: Iaeb84f1d9f4c04c23f470ad777d7d6cf2455f543
Closes-Bug: #1971530
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74e1fe4761b3bc4efb9a60d1b2887766c9ce43a9)
(cherry picked from commit a607ed8e999209f8a369f05191a0490ca426f4d6)

Ocata went to End of Life several months ago [1], but it took time to
transition all the projects and it was forgotten to mark Ocata series
status as EOL. This patch corrects now Ocata status.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/022989.html

commit_message:
Fix Ocata series state

Ocata went to End of Life several months ago [1], but it took time to
transition all the projects and it was forgotten to mark Ocata series
status as EOL. This patch corrects now Ocata status.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/022989.html

Change-Id: I7a5f71c731d9ad6e423e70c03210814d273a9974

commit_message:
Pass valid cert regen variable to pki role

Currently we're passing non-existant variable into PKI role
when defining whether to regen certificates or not.
This change fixes behaviour.

Change-Id: Ib1c8f820ccfe00923fcbc7aec2457a94629673fe

commit_message:
Mark requirements' ocata branch as EOL

Since every project transitioned to End of Life already, requirements
should have tagged with EOL, too. This patch tags latest patch on
stable/ocata with ocata-eol and the branch can be deleted afterwards.

Change-Id: I197457d2160a1668013854bd390779dc3c2c9002

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-05-13 13:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_cephadm/tasks/dashboard/configure_dashboard_backends.yml'], 'message': 'Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr
instance are not consistent anymore, and the purpose of this patch is to
rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

Closes-Bug: #1972729
Change-Id: Ifc9a0a9ac2f13c891ccde826aef2ab7cbdb5d690
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr
instance are not consistent anymore, and the purpose of this patch is to
rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

Closes-Bug: #1972729
Change-Id: Ifc9a0a9ac2f13c891ccde826aef2ab7cbdb5d690

subject: ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2022-05-12 09:55:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ovn-probe-timeouts-6b7747486d59e58e.yaml', 'ansible/roles/ovn/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ovn/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea‐
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea‐
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405

commit_message:
Add doc fix for all-in-one in venv

When running in virtual environment a bootstrapping task will
install 'docker' python module in the environment. After that
prechecks and deploy phase will not find the module because
their 'ansible interpreter' is host wide. With this fix it is
advised to set an interpreter to the one in virtual environment

Closes-Bug: #1969812
Change-Id: I1bb6a3af3fa6346fff0a262e0c53d12c544f46db
(cherry picked from commit 5bcf5391bc81c2eadfc24a619691316c02554f73)

subject: Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-12 11:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'message': "Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
"}]
commit_message:
Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383

commit_message:
Add package-upgrade action

The package-upgrade action performs package upgrades for the current
OpenStack release.

The code path used is similar to the openstack-upgrade action, with the
difference being that package-upgrade will not execute if an openstack
upgrade is available (based on the openstack-origin setting).

This change includes a charm-helpers sync.

Change-Id: I88ccffad7af2d2e9cddc1f6514ebd07898e117dc

subject: Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-06 20:31:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Closes-Bug: #1972023
Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e
"}]
commit_message:
Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Closes-Bug: #1972023
Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], dropping
the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Co-Authored-By: Manpreet Kaur <kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iff303aee59ca9232e10e41d478f04abb085b9051

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-04-30 02:38:17.000000000', 'files': ['reference/release-naming.rst'], 'message': 'Remove release names starting from 2023.1 release

It was discussed in the April 2022 PTG [1] and finally it was decided
that release names, even they are good from the marketing point of view,
makes a lot of troubles every cycle to choose something which would be
appropropriate for everyone.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L265

Change-Id: I1eee82afaa20a06bd1a2d0b4b0886e5c2cd44545
'}]
commit_message:
Remove release names starting from 2023.1 release

It was discussed in the April 2022 PTG [1] and finally it was decided
that release names, even they are good from the marketing point of view,
makes a lot of troubles every cycle to choose something which would be
appropropriate for everyone.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L265

Change-Id: I1eee82afaa20a06bd1a2d0b4b0886e5c2cd44545

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-12-08 00:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/tftp-master-path-d00eb11d04d6e1b9.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/cleanup-deployment-images.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml'], 'message': "Don't create ironic_tftp_master_path directory, change default

This will be created by ironic on startup. Not creating it here is
consistent with the move to have ironic be responsible for its own
setup/config where possible.

This commit also changes the bifrost default ironic_tftp_master_path
of /var/lib/ironic/master_images to the ironic [pxe]tftp_master_path
default of /tftpboot/master_images. This fixes a permission denied
issue when selinux is enforcing, since dnsmasq cannot access image
files with type var_lib_t.

Change-Id: I54c2f3ed417156d0130eb0e5b400cfc2a09b51fc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create ironic_tftp_master_path directory, change default

This will be created by ironic on startup. Not creating it here is
consistent with the move to have ironic be responsible for its own
setup/config where possible.

This commit also changes the bifrost default ironic_tftp_master_path
of /var/lib/ironic/master_images to the ironic [pxe]tftp_master_path
default of /tftpboot/master_images. This fixes a permission denied
issue when selinux is enforcing, since dnsmasq cannot access image
files with type var_lib_t.

Change-Id: I54c2f3ed417156d0130eb0e5b400cfc2a09b51fc

subject: Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-20 03:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Idd51e189d7e8dc5626a831c06a5a47ae5a11f5f7
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Idd51e189d7e8dc5626a831c06a5a47ae5a11f5f7

subject: Update auth_openidc_module path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-14 13:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openidc.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Update auth_openidc_module path

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module
path it seems to be relativ to the ServerRoot dir. Hence the module
is not loaded and Apache2 fail to start. Using an absolute path
works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524
'}]
commit_message:
Update auth_openidc_module path

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module
path it seems to be relativ to the ServerRoot dir. Hence the module
is not loaded and Apache2 fail to start. Using an absolute path
works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524

puppet modules.

commit_message:
[L3HA] Don't update HA router's ports if router isn't active on agents

In case when HA router isn't active on any L3 agent,
_ensure_host_set_on_port method shouldn't try to update port's host to
the host from which there was an rpc message sent, as this can be host
on which router is in the "standby" mode.
This method should only update port's host to the router's "active_host"
if there is such active_host found already.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/841489

Closes-Bug: #1973162
Closes-Bug: #1942190
Change-Id: Ib3945d294601b35f9b268c25841cd284b52c4ca3

commit_message:
Fix malformed OIDCMemCacheServers

Change from comma separated list of memcache servers to space separated list.
Comma seperated list results in a 500 error response.
Upstream docs state this should be space separated and can be found here:
https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf#L629-L631

Closes-Bug: #1972033
Change-Id: Ibaef3672c656213dd5ba1488379d686130e041c5

commit_message:
Save COMPOSE_ID info after setting up repos

This patch adds a command to save current COMPOSE_ID configured in the
mirrors at the moment that the job is being executed.
This information can be useful when comparing new failures with previous
success or failed jobs.

Change-Id: I804f4ae26846734f6e182da9c44ff77426dabce4
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate ineffective ManilaCephFSCephFSEnableSnapshots

The cephfs_enable_snapshots parameter was deprecated in Manila[1]
during Victoria and was removed during Wallaby. Now Manila always
enables snapshot support for CephFS backend. Following that deprecation
in Manila, the corresponding parameter of puppet-manila was deprecated
during the Victoria cycle [2] and it is being removed during the Xena
cycle.

This deprecates the corresponding parameter from tripleo-heat-tempaltes
because it has no effect since Wallaby.

[1] 2d7c46445396b0db780ba456ffb9284b177a6ae4
[2] 2388d7510d600e358c76becf13d08581b489f2a7

NOTE(stable/wallaby):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to the changes in
  deployment/manila/manila-backend-cephfs.yaml that were introduced in xena:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/816737

  This deprecation change should be backported in order to introduce
  these deprecation removal changes:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/839358

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I81565290603eb60c8c18e64c95ead7b761e8cb78
(cherry picked from commit e0cb3c62764dbec7bccb5148a04c82547334afab)

and complete removal from Python 3.12.

This patch preempts any future issues and follows the long

Change-Id: Ie455f3f32a0681d2d7eb54344f9186d09d3de80f

commit_message:
Replace distutils with packaging in 3rd party drivers

PEP632 defines the deprecation of `distutils` from Python 3.10
and complete removal from Python 3.12.

This patch preempts any future issues and follows the long
standing recommendation to replace distutils with setuptools
(packaging in the case of version string checking)

Change-Id: Ie455f3f32a0681d2d7eb54344f9186d09d3de80f

Add an enable_cinder_backend_pure_iscsi and
enable_cinder_backend_pure_fc options to etc/kolla/globals.yml
to enable use of the FlashArray backend.
Update the documentation to include a section on configuring
Cinder with the FlashArray.

the regex to catch nodes that are on standby mode. This change
updates the regex for not alerting on paused units.

subject: Prevent errors when private-address=None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py'], 'message': 'Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)

subject: Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'templates/corosync.conf', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'message': "Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)

subject: Don't bootstrap osds on mon-relation-departed hook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-13 18:50:05.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py'], 'message': "Don't bootstrap osds on mon-relation-departed hook

The charm attempts to bootstrap OSDs on both the mon-relation-changed
and the mon-relation-departed hooks. There is no logical reason that
the OSDs should be bootstrapped in the -departed hook.

Change-Id: I79a790291b0e361d2748d6bed8c989d16ad36daf
Closes-Bug: #1885195
"}]
commit_message:
Don't bootstrap osds on mon-relation-departed hook

The charm attempts to bootstrap OSDs on both the mon-relation-changed
and the mon-relation-departed hooks. There is no logical reason that
the OSDs should be bootstrapped in the -departed hook.

Change-Id: I79a790291b0e361d2748d6bed8c989d16ad36daf
Closes-Bug: #1885195

Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively

the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield

commit_message:
Manila: Deprecate ineffctive *DriverHandlesShareServers

In puppet-manila, the driver_handlers_share_servers parameter have been
deprecated for some backends[1] because these backends can only accept
true or false and accpepting arbitrary value results in manila service
failing to start.
This change deprecate the corresponding parameters in template files so
that we can remove usage of these deprecated parameters.

[1] 4c365c9064845e73a1da0f868ebba5a00c6a5c7a

NOTE(stable/wallaby):
  The backport dealt with conflicts due to the changes in
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-isilon.yaml
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-vmax.yaml
   - deployment/manila/manila-backend-vnx.yaml
  that were introduced in xena:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/816737

  This deprecation change should be backported in order to introduce
  these deprecation removal changes:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/839358

Change-Id: I7cd02aa0f107e74ec35be3d1928d7aa661885d40
(cherry picked from commit 8a7201cd055a14769c60267077c467011633f7ae)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-05-06 15:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/apache/apache-baremetal-puppet.j2.yaml'], 'message': 'Stop generating certificate requests for disabled networks

The certificate requests created based on ApacheNetworks require fqdn_NETWORK to be set.
The will only be defined for the networks that are enabled for the current role.

Currently requests are generated for all networks. This happens to work for the Controller role
as all networks are enabled. However it fails on DCN compute nodes that are not on the external
network (they use apache for local glance-api services).

Change-Id: I05ba5fb48c617a5bbedebb8b74c23bec9abf3bbd
'}]
commit_message:
Stop generating certificate requests for disabled networks

The certificate requests created based on ApacheNetworks require fqdn_NETWORK to be set.
The will only be defined for the networks that are enabled for the current role.

Currently requests are generated for all networks. This happens to work for the Controller role
as all networks are enabled. However it fails on DCN compute nodes that are not on the external
network (they use apache for local glance-api services).

Change-Id: I05ba5fb48c617a5bbedebb8b74c23bec9abf3bbd

subject: accept ssh diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 and update cert-manager
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8863, 'name': 'Andrii Ostapenko', 'email': 'anost1986@gmail.com', 'username': 'aostapenko'}, {'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24780, 'name': 'Sangeet Gupta', 'email': 'sg774j@att.com', 'username': 'sgupta'}, {'_account_id': 30777, 'name': 'Steven Fitzpatrick', 'email': 'steven@fitzpatrick.wtf', 'username': 'sf280x'}, {'_account_id': 34668, 'name': 'Dylan Murphy', 'email': 'v-dymurphy@microsoft.com', 'username': 'dmurphy-igms'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2022-05-13 17:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/deployment/developer/common/900-use-it.sh', 'tools/scripts/tls/cert-manager.sh'], 'message': 'accept ssh diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 and update cert-manager

openssh-client, etc. updated and might not accept these algos by
default. Cirros images should probably be updated at some point to
use a new SSH server.

Update cert-manager to 1.8.0 because [1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh`
to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I5ea204bbcd7add2f787df79ac1d996842f4d1fcc
'}]
commit_message:
accept ssh diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 and update cert-manager

openssh-client, etc. updated and might not accept these algos by
default. Cirros images should probably be updated at some point to
use a new SSH server.

Update cert-manager to 1.8.0 because [1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh`
to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I5ea204bbcd7add2f787df79ac1d996842f4d1fcc

commit_message:

commit_message:
Add tripleo_container_standalone role

The tripleo_container_standalone role is used to manage TripleO
containers defined by other standalone Ansible roles instead of these
container definitions being defined in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-On: I3e6dba0539b9622433ce74e18b5fbdc05e5bcaaf
Change-Id: I119dbf19b4fd3b8320811bba284e40fa07d2d79a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I3f72768442b3690f8ec85d5d15102ae6825dddd8

subject: update cert-manager to 1.8.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-13 16:12:59.000000000', 'files': ['tools/scripts/tls/cert-manager.sh'], 'message': 'update cert-manager to 1.8.0

[1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh` to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I13722754cccfc410b2c4c2948b8a729a2df824d9
'}]
commit_message:
update cert-manager to 1.8.0

[1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh` to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I13722754cccfc410b2c4c2948b8a729a2df824d9

commit_message:
trivial: fix deprecation warning in notification fixture

This change simply replaces calling notifyAll() with
notify_all() on the threading condition object in
the notification fixture.

notify_all() was introduced in python 2.6

Change-Id: If8d386f20693016dd35ecfdbc703bf31aa103a67

subject: Revert "Block neutron-lib 2.21.0"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8313, 'name': 'Lajos Katona', 'display_name': 'lajoskatona', 'email': 'katonalala@gmail.com', 'username': 'elajkat', 'status': 'Eicsson Software Technologies'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-13 10:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "Block neutron-lib 2.21.0"

This reverts commit 5a8e4c5122389d010b74d0d8c84336b3ceb142ed.

Reason for revert:
The error found in LP#1973162 and LP#1942190 seems to be in the Neutron
L3 code. There is a race condition when two routers try to update a HA
port. With [1][2], this is more evident as we protect the DB transactions
and Neutron always creates two active port bindings for the same port.

[3] is addressing this problem. I'm reverting this patch to test [3]
with neutron-lib 2.21.0

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/828738
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833247
[3]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841712

Change-Id: I099703bb72291afa9cb7a5130b823334303528d5
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Block neutron-lib 2.21.0"

This reverts commit 5a8e4c5122389d010b74d0d8c84336b3ceb142ed.

Reason for revert:
The error found in LP#1973162 and LP#1942190 seems to be in the Neutron
L3 code. There is a race condition when two routers try to update a HA
port. With [1][2], this is more evident as we protect the DB transactions
and Neutron always creates two active port bindings for the same port.

[3] is addressing this problem. I'm reverting this patch to test [3]
with neutron-lib 2.21.0

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/828738
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833247
[3]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841712

Change-Id: I099703bb72291afa9cb7a5130b823334303528d5

subject: Allow logging of Content-Type text/plain
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-04-29 15:57:52.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py'], 'message': "Allow logging of Content-Type text/plain

Noticed this while doing some local testing, if a WSGI app replies with
a text/plain content type to communicate a server error, we aren't able
to see the error response message when passing --debug to the
openstackclient, example:

  RESP: [500] Date: Thu, 01 Oct 2020 23:54:15 GMT Server: Apache/2.4.18
  (Ubuntu) Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 Connection: close
  Transfer-Encoding: chunked
  RESP BODY: Omitted, Content-Type is set to text/plain; charset=UTF-8.
  Only application/json responses have their bodies logged.

Change-Id: Ibfd46c7725bd0aa26f1f80b0e8fc6eda2ac2e090
"}]
commit_message:
Allow logging of Content-Type text/plain

Noticed this while doing some local testing, if a WSGI app replies with
a text/plain content type to communicate a server error, we aren't able
to see the error response message when passing --debug to the
openstackclient, example:

  RESP: [500] Date: Thu, 01 Oct 2020 23:54:15 GMT Server: Apache/2.4.18
  (Ubuntu) Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 Connection: close
  Transfer-Encoding: chunked
  RESP BODY: Omitted, Content-Type is set to text/plain; charset=UTF-8.
  Only application/json responses have their bodies logged.

Change-Id: Ibfd46c7725bd0aa26f1f80b0e8fc6eda2ac2e090

subject: Fix version discovery check of url for integer project id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-12 23:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/discover.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_discovery.py'], 'message': 'Fix version discovery check of url for integer project id

Check if the last url segment matches the project id.
Previously the check only confirmed whether the last url segment
endswith the project id which could cause problems with spurious
matches of some legacy integer project ids.

Closes-Bug: 1968793
Change-Id: I7c6c22e41bde2a73508635b7e964c58a02c12146
'}]
commit_message:
Fix version discovery check of url for integer project id

Check if the last url segment matches the project id.
Previously the check only confirmed whether the last url segment
endswith the project id which could cause problems with spurious
matches of some legacy integer project ids.

Closes-Bug: 1968793
Change-Id: I7c6c22e41bde2a73508635b7e964c58a02c12146

commit_message:
New test cases for tsigkey tests suite

1) test_create_tsigkey_for_zone_invalid_algorithm
   Try to create tsigkey using invalid algorithm.
   Expected: 400 BadRequest.
2) test_create_tsigkey_for_zone_invalid_name
   Try to create tsigkey using invalid name.
   Expected: 400 BadRequest.
3) test_create_tsigkey_for_zone_empty_secret
   Try to create tsigkey using invalid name.
   Expected: 400 BadRequest.
4) test_create_tsigkey_for_zone_invalid_scope
   Try to create tsigkey using invalid scope.
   Expected: 400 BadRequest.
5) test_create_tsigkey_for_zone_invalid_zone_id
   Try to create tsigkey using invalid resource(zone_id).
   Expected: 400 BadRequest.
6) test_create_tsigkey_for_pool
   Create a tsigkey for a pool.
   Expected: should PASS
7) test_create_tsigkey_for_pool_with_scope_zone
   Conflict scenario, resource ID used is of a pool, but scope
   provided is: "ZONE".
8) test_list_tsigkeys_limit_results
   Use "limit" in URL query to limit listed tsigkeys in list API.
9) test_list_tsigkeys_using_marker
    Use "marker" in URL query in list API, to get the subsequent tsigkeys.
10) test_list_tsigkey_sort_key_with_sort_direction
    Sort listed results using: "sort_key" and "sort_dir"
    parameters in URL query of list API.
11) test_list_tsigkey_filter_by_name
    Filter listed tsigkeys results by "name" provided in URL query.
12) test_list_tsigkey_filter_by_scope
    Filter listed tsigkeys results by "scope" provided in URL query.
13) test_list_tsigkey_filter_by_algorithm
    Filter listed tsigkeys results by "algorithm" provided in URL query.

Change-Id: If76296187707b92326a201b0cd3f7d89c4cc064e

commit_message:
Adding roles.galaxy to the gitignore

The newly documented manual role testing procedure leads to
creation of several new directories intended to support
the test operation.

These directories are temporary and shouldn't be tracked
under any circumstances.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit fc889a24a4d98b8d358c13105d4713956aa9a4d5)

subject: memcached: Give callers the option to accept errors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-04-28 20:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/common/memcached.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/unit/common/test_memcached.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "memcached: Give callers the option to accept errors

Auth middlewares in particular may want to *know* when there's a
communication breakdown as opposed to a cache miss.

Update our shard-range cache stats to acknowlegde the distinction.

Drive-by: Log an error if all memcached servers are error-limited.

Change-Id: Ic8d0915235d11124d06ec940c5be9a2edbe85c83
"}]
commit_message:
memcached: Give callers the option to accept errors

Auth middlewares in particular may want to *know* when there's a
communication breakdown as opposed to a cache miss.

Update our shard-range cache stats to acknowlegde the distinction.

Drive-by: Log an error if all memcached servers are error-limited.

Change-Id: Ic8d0915235d11124d06ec940c5be9a2edbe85c83

commit_message:
Don't extract dns_domain when not set

If the networks dns_domain is None, do not add a dns_domain
entry in the network data YAML file with 'null' value.

Closes-Bug: #1970604
Change-Id: I9fbdc6a82d483e0eaff8df87ad569f11ed22cd2b

commit_message:
Fix standby node regex for check_crm

Pacemaker has changed the output format of crm_mon and this broke
the regex to catch nodes that are on standby mode. This change
updates the regex for not alerting on paused units.

Change-Id: I137acad076bff58506fea6e1618a00765adacd9b
Closes-Bug: #1971182
Related-Bug: #1880576
(cherry picked from commit a0b419519cd438affb24ff80c0221cc33d884c9a)

subject: Stop using private _is_uuid_like method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-20 14:43:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/server_event.py', 'openstackclient/image/v2/image.py'], 'message': 'Stop using private _is_uuid_like method

currently this double-private method of a dependency library
is used in several places (openstack.cloud._utils._is_uuid_like)

openstacksdk deliberatly chose not to depend on oslo.utils to keep
dependenies to the minimum, so it just copied several methods from it,
including the is_uuid_like.

python-openstackclient however already depends on oslo.utils, so
using the public method from oslo.utils should be preferred
and more stable.

Change-Id: I578ffa36ffb00c9d47ee12a149313201973edd32
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using private _is_uuid_like method

currently this double-private method of a dependency library
is used in several places (openstack.cloud._utils._is_uuid_like)

openstacksdk deliberatly chose not to depend on oslo.utils to keep
dependenies to the minimum, so it just copied several methods from it,
including the is_uuid_like.

python-openstackclient however already depends on oslo.utils, so
using the public method from oslo.utils should be preferred
and more stable.

Change-Id: I578ffa36ffb00c9d47ee12a149313201973edd32

commit_message:
[Puppet OpenStack] Transition stein to EOL

This is the last step to retire old stable branches in Puppet
OpenStack repos and makes stable/stein EOL. The proposal was sent to
the mailing list[1] and we haven't heard any objections.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-October/025589.html

Change-Id: Iaf92d1d1e3e8ff58a607477ef600b973c7b3d1ee

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2020-05-15 16:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file
as theose are blacklisted requirements and does not need to be present
there.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I3033238092f115937e2e24d3242c01efd4d2ed7d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file
as theose are blacklisted requirements and does not need to be present
there.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I3033238092f115937e2e24d3242c01efd4d2ed7d

subject: volume: Add 'block storage resource filter list' command
revisions:

optional '--resource {resource}' option to limit the listed filters to a

We used the 'block storage resource filter' terminology rather than
simply 'resource filter' to highlight the fact that this is specific to

Note that while this feature is a bit weird, good documentation can be

"}]
commit_message:
volume: Add 'block storage resource filter list' command

These are based on the 'cinder list-filters' command, which accepts an
optional '--resource {resource}' option to limit the listed filters to a
single resource type.

  block storage resource filter list
  block storage resource filter show

We used the 'block storage resource filter' terminology rather than
simply 'resource filter' to highlight the fact that this is specific to
the block storage service.

Note that while this feature is a bit weird, good documentation can be
found at [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/generalized_filters.html

Change-Id: I21e7c0ea427aef1f6665394d4b8e9a1f30d6dbb1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove key "l7_policies" in pool dict

It will update pool when creating healthmonitor.
But we only need to update healthmonitor_id, and don't
care about others, so remove irrespective keys.

subject: Improve speed of listing from DB
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-12-11 18:38:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancerv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/models.py'], 'message': 'Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools, get_listeners,
get_healthmonitors, get_l7policies, get_l7policy_rules,
get_pool_members.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
(cherry picked from commit 397a6fe39c72ac091d53da610682ec4f95ade2ed)
(cherry picked from commit b9b6b6a272ef3d9ea7606a47714d0d5ec9bd4c69)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools, get_listeners,
get_healthmonitors, get_l7policies, get_l7policy_rules,
get_pool_members.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
(cherry picked from commit 397a6fe39c72ac091d53da610682ec4f95ade2ed)
(cherry picked from commit b9b6b6a272ef3d9ea7606a47714d0d5ec9bd4c69)

subject: neutron-lbaas haproxy agent prevent vif unplug when failover occurs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-06 09:20:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/agent/agent_manager.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/haproxy/test_namespace_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/agent/test_agent_manager.py'], 'message': 'neutron-lbaas haproxy agent prevent vif unplug when failover occurs

When lbaas fails over after an agent is unresponsive, the dead
agent on coming up should not unplug the vif port, if the lbaas
is active on other agent and when failover is configured.

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I76c38b20eb72c1dba0a0a2a140bbe77053aa3ed0
Closes-Bug: #1779194
(cherry picked from commit 72399374b222bd4a9d192081bfab2344af27fdd3)
'}]
commit_message:
neutron-lbaas haproxy agent prevent vif unplug when failover occurs

When lbaas fails over after an agent is unresponsive, the dead
agent on coming up should not unplug the vif port, if the lbaas
is active on other agent and when failover is configured.

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I76c38b20eb72c1dba0a0a2a140bbe77053aa3ed0
Closes-Bug: #1779194
(cherry picked from commit 72399374b222bd4a9d192081bfab2344af27fdd3)

subject: Fix memory leak in the haproxy provider driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-06 10:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/haproxy/test_namespace_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix memory leak in the haproxy provider driver

The haproxy provider driver uses a dict for caching load balancer
resources (including children resources). That alone already increases

is deleted without freeing it up (unless neutron-server is restart)

commit_message:
Fix memory leak in the haproxy provider driver

The haproxy provider driver uses a dict for caching load balancer
resources (including children resources). That alone already increases
memory consumption. A neutron-server restart solves this.

But the real issue is that the driver leaves some data behind when a LB
is deleted without freeing it up (unless neutron-server is restart)
hence the memory leak.

Story: 2003802
Task: 26534

Change-Id: I7c79271998d839c6afbeb6d92f888f6acd67704e
(cherry picked from commit 111d0b285200961fa796532688ae65d4ca801ce8)
(cherry picked from commit 40457e2573282243846655d993fae1ddbd671729)

subject: Fix "unable to delete subnet" in API tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-20 09:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/api/test_load_balancers_admin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix "unable to delete subnet" in API tests

We have been seeing occasional "unable to delete subnet, One or more ports
have an IP allocation from this subnet." errors in the
neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-api tests. This tends to happen on slower test hosts.
My suspicion is that since the port deletion is asynchronous, we are trying
to delete the subnet before neutron finishes the port deletion.
The neutron logs [1] appear to back this theory.

This patch adds a wait for the port to finish deletion in neutron before
moving on to delete the subnet.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/539068/2/check/neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-api/ \
    6fba02b/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Jan_30_21_33_58_634644

Change-Id: I3baea0319114c9c5a2f8839d4a6b90f9022fefe7
(cherry picked from commit bf8c3035189c791c24e7bb2fb12fd217b71b20c4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "unable to delete subnet" in API tests

We have been seeing occasional "unable to delete subnet, One or more ports
have an IP allocation from this subnet." errors in the
neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-api tests. This tends to happen on slower test hosts.
My suspicion is that since the port deletion is asynchronous, we are trying
to delete the subnet before neutron finishes the port deletion.
The neutron logs [1] appear to back this theory.

This patch adds a wait for the port to finish deletion in neutron before
moving on to delete the subnet.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/539068/2/check/neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-api/ \
    6fba02b/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Jan_30_21_33_58_634644

Change-Id: I3baea0319114c9c5a2f8839d4a6b90f9022fefe7
(cherry picked from commit bf8c3035189c791c24e7bb2fb12fd217b71b20c4)

commit_message:
Remove DDT tests from tempest plugin

The DDT tests were removed from neutron-lbaas in Rocky[1] as part
of another patch.
The gates have not run these tests since, at the latest, Mitaka
and they were never stable.
This patch is a "backport" of the removal of these non-functional
tests.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/561049/

Change-Id: I73d1824265cad4d24535d3a15b263491f12fde56
(cherry picked from commit fae9d93e0be3aa50e1d28a484139e0559716b33d)

commit_message:
Remove neutron-lbaas from the CI jobs requirements

Neutron-lbaas was retired some time ago [1] so there's no need
to keep it in the requirements of the CI jobs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006158.html

Squashed to it:
[stable][pike]: remove publish-openstack-sphinx-docs template

Sphinx build jobs on older branches (stable/queens, stable/pike) are
failing due to missing python 2.7 support for it, see [1], till an
Openstack global solution is accepted, let's remove the job template.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-February/027106.html

Change-Id: I6727d2d1c4b1a727fd94ad14d030ae43c21f7844

In initially fixing the multinode key access to the

attempting to generate and leverage an ssh key locally

commit_message:
CI: use pre-existing ssh key on multinode jobs

In initially fixing the multinode key access to the
subnode, we inadvertently now broke ssh access
post-upgrade to the controller local host as it is
attempting to generate and leverage an ssh key locally
which can't really work. So instead, used the provided
keys if present.

Change-Id: I930f034c47bd1d2729ce43cd07c28cc7c1126402

commit_message:
[publishing] use a new naming scheme

This change switches published images names from the current
format <base_distro>-<image_name>:<openstack_release>-<arch_suffix>
to a preciser and image-oriented (for better variant listing) format
<image_name>:<openstack_release>-<base_distro>-<base_distro_version>-<arch_suffix>

Change-Id: I6a4b5c2087b94f96f72aa9d0d0781ff14d3ee6bb

commit_message:
volume: Add 'block storage cluster *' commands

These mirror the 'cinder cluster-*' commands, with arguments copied
across essentially verbatim. The only significant departure is the
replacement of "tenant" terminology with "project".

  block storage cluster list
  block storage cluster set
  block storage cluster show

We used the 'block storage' terminology rather than simply 'volume' to
allow us to start distinguishing between the volume service and a volume
resource.

Change-Id: I9105a9e4a139af4929e3b1f3a6de6c9a53e0b598
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Document how to fix release circular dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-11-25 14:36:10.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/_independent/reno.yaml', 'deliverables/_independent/openstack-governance.yaml', 'deliverables/_independent/pbr.yaml'], 'message': "Document how to fix release circular dependencies

openstack/releases has a number of dependencies, and some of them (reno,
pbr, openstack-governance) are released using openstack/releases itself.

This may create circular dependencies issues, if one of those
dependencies becomes uninstallable: in that case we won't be able to use
openstack/releases to release a fixed version.

The proper way to solve this issue is to push a tag manually to trigger
the release of the affected repository, then retroactively push the
corresponding openstack/releases change. This will be a noop tag-wise
but make sure that the metadata is correct going forward.

This patch leaves comments in the affected files, so that we remember
how to solve this next time it happens!

Change-Id: I695e83410ba704e9978147e226e9555890a848a8
"}]
commit_message:
Document how to fix release circular dependencies

openstack/releases has a number of dependencies, and some of them (reno,
pbr, openstack-governance) are released using openstack/releases itself.

This may create circular dependencies issues, if one of those
dependencies becomes uninstallable: in that case we won't be able to use
openstack/releases to release a fixed version.

The proper way to solve this issue is to push a tag manually to trigger
the release of the affected repository, then retroactively push the
corresponding openstack/releases change. This will be a noop tag-wise
but make sure that the metadata is correct going forward.

This patch leaves comments in the affected files, so that we remember
how to solve this next time it happens!

Change-Id: I695e83410ba704e9978147e226e9555890a848a8
